Doc: A type defining the FX observations to be used to convert the observed Commodity Reference Price to the Settlement Currency. The rate source must be specified. Additionally, a time for the spot price to be observed on that source may be specified, or else an averaging schedule for trades priced using an average FX rate.

Source.Contents:
/#
   A type defining the FX observations to be used to convert the observed Commodity Reference Price to the Settlement Currency. The rate source must be specified. Additionally, a time for the spot price to be observed on that source may be specified, or else an averaging schedule for trades priced using an average FX rate.
 #/
record FpML5.reporting.CommodityFx {
  # The primary source for where the rate observation will occur. Will typically be either a page or a reference bank published rate.
  primaryRateSource : FpML5.reporting.InformationSource?

  # An alternative, or secondary, source for where the rate observation will occur. Will typically be either a page or a reference bank published rate.
  secondaryRateSource : FpML5.reporting.InformationSource?

  # A type to identify how the FX rate will be applied. This is intended to differentiate between the various methods for applying FX to the floating price such as a daily calculation, or averaging the FX and applying the average at the end of each CalculationPeriod.
  fxType : string?

  # The parties may specify a Method of Averaging when averaging of the FX rate is applicable.
  averagingMethod : string?

  # A list of the fx observation dates for a given Calculation Period.
  fxObservationDates : FpML5.reporting.AdjustableDates

  # The type of day on which pricing occurs.
  dayType : FpML5.reporting.CommodityDayTypeEnum?

  # The method by which the pricing days are distributed across the pricing period.
  dayDistribution : string?

  # The number of days over which pricing should take place.
  dayCount : int( 1, * )?

  # The day(s) of the week on which pricing will take place during the pricing period.
  dayOfWeek : string?

  # The occurrence of the dayOfWeek within the pricing period on which pricing will take place, e.g. the 3rd Friday within each Calculation Period. If omitted, every dayOfWeek will be a pricing day.
  dayNumber : int?

  # The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.
  businessDayConvention : string?

  # The pricing period per calculation period if the pricing days do not wholly fall within the respective calculation period.
  lag : FpML5.reporting.Lag

  # Allows a lag to reference one already defined elsewhere in the trade.
  lagReference : FpML5.reporting.LagReference

  # A pointer style reference to the Calculation Periods defined on another leg.
  calculationPeriodsReference : FpML5.reporting.CalculationPeriodsReference

  # A pointer style reference to the Calculation Periods Schedule defined on another leg.
  calculationPeriodsScheduleReference : FpML5.reporting.CalculationPeriodsScheduleReference

  # A pointer style reference to single-day-duration Calculation Periods defined on another leg.
  calculationPeriodsDatesReference : FpML5.reporting.CalculationPeriodsDatesReference

  # The time at which the spot currency exchange rate will be observed. It is specified as a time in a specific business center, e.g. 11:00am London time.
  fixingTime : FpML5.reporting.BusinessCenterTime?

}

primaryRateSource.Doc: The primary source for where the rate observation will occur. Will typically be either a page or a reference bank published rate.
primaryRateSource.Name: primaryRateSource

secondaryRateSource.Doc: An alternative, or secondary, source for where the rate observation will occur. Will typically be either a page or a reference bank published rate.
secondaryRateSource.Name: secondaryRateSource

fxType.Doc: A type to identify how the FX rate will be applied. This is intended to differentiate between the various methods for applying FX to the floating price such as a daily calculation, or averaging the FX and applying the average at the end of each CalculationPeriod.
fxType.Name: fxType

averagingMethod.Doc: The parties may specify a Method of Averaging when averaging of the FX rate is applicable.
averagingMethod.Name: averagingMethod

fxObservationDates.Doc: A list of the fx observation dates for a given Calculation Period.
fxObservationDates.Name: fxObservationDates

dayType.Doc: The type of day on which pricing occurs.
dayType.Name: dayType

dayDistribution.Doc: The method by which the pricing days are distributed across the pricing period.
dayDistribution.Name: dayDistribution

dayCount.Doc: The number of days over which pricing should take place.
dayCount.Name: dayCount

dayOfWeek.Doc: The day(s) of the week on which pricing will take place during the pricing period.
dayOfWeek.Name: dayOfWeek

dayNumber.Doc: The occurrence of the dayOfWeek within the pricing period on which pricing will take place, e.g. the 3rd Friday within each Calculation Period. If omitted, every dayOfWeek will be a pricing day.
dayNumber.Name: dayNumber

businessDayConvention.Doc: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.
businessDayConvention.Name: businessDayConvention

lag.Doc: The pricing period per calculation period if the pricing days do not wholly fall within the respective calculation period.
lag.Name: lag

lagReference.Doc: Allows a lag to reference one already defined elsewhere in the trade.
lagReference.Name: lagReference

calculationPeriodsReference.Doc: A pointer style reference to the Calculation Periods defined on another leg.
calculationPeriodsReference.Name: calculationPeriodsReference

calculationPeriodsScheduleReference.Doc: A pointer style reference to the Calculation Periods Schedule defined on another leg.
calculationPeriodsScheduleReference.Name: calculationPeriodsScheduleReference

calculationPeriodsDatesReference.Doc: A pointer style reference to single-day-duration Calculation Periods defined on another leg.
calculationPeriodsDatesReference.Name: calculationPeriodsDatesReference

fixingTime.Doc: The time at which the spot currency exchange rate will be observed. It is specified as a time in a specific business center, e.g. 11:00am London time.
fixingTime.Name: fixingTime
